belongs_to_collection.name: The Character of Physical Law - Messenger Lectures at Cornell University, 1964

original_title: Lecture 2: The Relation of Mathematics and Physics
overview: In this lecture, Dr. Richard Feynman explores the relationship between mathematics and physics. He discusses the use of mathematics, its power as a reasoning tool, the two traditions in science, and the fact that pursuits in physics have many possible starting points.
title: Lecture 2: The Relation of Mathematics and Physics
